intro: Spermacoce ampliata, commonly known as the broadleaf moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Spermacoce ampliata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
